company called Lighthouse Network.
I do not recall CardConnect ever using the fictitious name "Lighthouse
Network" when referring to the actual Lighthouse Network.
9. However, it was common practice for CardConnect employees and/or ISOs to create
fictitious names or "alter egos" of competitors, including Shift4, when trying to sign new merchants.
10. For example, my sales team and I created a fictitious name for Shift4, "Shit4,"
when competing against them for business.
11. The purpose of doing so was to attempt to create additional separation between
CardConnect and Shift4 in the mind of a potential merchant to create an unfair advantage for
CardConnect.
12. We would also use the "Shit4" alter ego when referring to Shift4 in text messages
and emails, as well as in conversations with merchants.
13. I and other members of my sales team at CardConnect continued to use this term
when communicating about Shift4 with CardConnect personnel after my departure from
CardConnect. See Exhibit A.
14. While I was employed at Shift4, I completed a Data Security Training course and
certification assessment on or about January 5, 2021. See Exhibit B.
15. The system that Shift4 used, and continues to use, for its Data Security Training
and assessment is called "OneTrust."
16. I have read the Complaint in this case and I have no personal knowledge of Shift4
utilizing CardConnect's trade secrets to compete with CardConnect.
17. To the best of my knowledge, I have never shared any CardConnect trade secrets
with anyone at Shift4.

Executed on this 14 day of July, 2022.

**Summary of Findings:**

*   **OneTrust:** Shift4 used OneTrust for Data Security Training and certification in 2021, and likely 2022, but the witness (Taylor Lafee) was unsure about its use in 2020. **Key Observations and Summary**

*   **Airtable as a CRM:** The Airtable data clearly shows Shift4 (or at least a team within Shift4) was using Airtable as a Customer Relationship Management (CRM) system to track leads and opportunities, specifically targeting CardConnect partners.  The columns like "Status," "Next Step," "Sales Rep," and "Deal Notes" are typical CRM fields. The "Won/Lost Date" is also critical.
*   **Text Message Tone:** The text messages are generally professional and focused on scheduling calls and following up.  They demonstrate persistent efforts to connect and maintain contact. The messages do indicate a pre-existing relationship and familiarity.
*   **Redactions Limit Full Context:** While the OCR provides the text, the heavy redactions (especially of names and specific company details) in the Airtable data obscure the full context of the deals being tracked. In the text messages, the redaction of the name is obvious, but blocks being able to directly relate the airtable and text message exhibits.
* The dates begin in 2017, and go to mid 2018.

I have presented the raw, OCR'd text and the text message content to the best of my ability, given the constraints of the provided documents, redactions, and the nature of OCR technology. I have provided you with the key insights that I am able to gain.
